Which HTML tag is used for creating a hyperlink?

What is the purpose of the 'DOCTYPE' declaration in HTML?
options: Defines the document type and version of HTML
HTML.answer: Defines the document type and version of HTML

HTML.question: Which HTML tag is used for creating a form?
What is the purpose of the 'meta' tag in HTML?
options: Adds a script to the document

HTML.question: Which HTML tag is used for creating a line break?
What is the purpose of the 'data-*' attributes in HTML?
options: Providing additional information using custom attributes
HTML.answer: Providing additional information using custom attributes

HTML.question: Explain the difference between 'block-level' and 'inline' elements in HTML.
options: Block-level elements stack vertically, while inline elements stack horizontally
Block-level elements are displayed without line breaks, while inline elements respect line breaks
Block-level elements cannot contain inline elements, while inline elements can contain block-level elements
Block-level elements have a fixed width, while inline elements adjust to the content width
HTML.answer: Block-level elements stack vertically, while inline elements stack horizontally

HTML.question: What is the purpose of the 'figure' and 'figcaption' elements in HTML?
Explain the concept of HTML semantic elements and provide examples.
options: Semantic elements add style to the document
Semantic elements convey meaning about the structure of the document
Semantic elements are only used for styling purposes
HTML.answer: Semantic elements convey meaning about the structure of the document

HTML.question: What is the purpose of the 'details' and 'summary' elements in HTML?

CSS.question: Which CSS property is used for changing the text color of an element?
What is the default value of the 'position' property in CSS?
Which CSS property is used for controlling the spacing between elements?
In CSS, what does the 'float' property do?
options: Moves an element to the right or left of its container
Applies a shadow to the element
CSS.answer: Moves an element to the right or left of its container

CSS.question: Which CSS pseudo-class is used for styling a link that has been visited?
What is the purpose of the 'box-sizing' property in CSS?
options: Controls how the width and height are calculated
Sets the border style of an element
Defines the layout of a page
CSS.answer: Controls how the width and height are calculated

CSS.question: Which CSS unit is relative to the font-size of the root element?
What does the 'z-index' property in CSS control?
Which CSS property is used for setting the background color of an element?
Explain the CSS Box Model and its components.
options: The CSS Box Model is not used in modern web design
The Box Model includes margin, border, padding, and content
The Box Model only includes width and height
The Box Model is used exclusively for styling text
CSS.answer: The Box Model includes margin, border, padding, and content

CSS.question: What is the purpose of the 'transform' property in CSS?
options: Changes the font style of text
Flips the layout of the page

CSS.question: Explain the CSS specificity hierarchy.
options: The hierarchy is based on alphabetical order
The hierarchy is based on the order of elements in the HTML document
The hierarchy is based on the importance of styles
The hierarchy is based on the complexity of selectors
CSS.answer: The hierarchy is based on the importance of styles

CSS.question: What is the purpose of the 'keyframes' rule in CSS?
options: Defines the layout of a page
Specifies the font style for text
Creates animations by gradually changing from one set of CSS styles to another
Sets the order of elements in the HTML document
CSS.answer: Creates animations by gradually changing from one set of CSS styles to another

CSS.question: Explain the concept of CSS Grid Layout and its advantages.
options: CSS Grid Layout is used for text formatting
CSS Grid Layout is a layout system for the web that allows complex two-dimensional layouts
CSS Grid Layout only works with inline elements
CSS Grid Layout is an outdated styling technique
CSS.answer: CSS Grid Layout is a layout system for the web that allows complex two-dimensional layouts

JavaScript.question: Explain the concept of the 'RESTful API' in JavaScript.
options: RESTful API is a method for creating dynamic web pages
RESTful API is a programming paradigm that uses HTTP requests to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations
RESTful API is only used for server-side JavaScript
RESTful API is an outdated approach to web development
JavaScript.answer: RESTful API is a programming paradigm that uses HTTP requests to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations

JavaScript.question: Which keyword is used for declaring variables in JavaScript?
Which object is used for handling errors in JavaScript?
How do you write a single-line comment in JavaScript?
Explain the difference between 'let', 'const', and 'var' in JavaScript.
options: They are interchangeable and can be used in any context
'let' is used for variables that should not be reassigned, 'const' is used for variables that can be reassigned, and 'var' is an outdated keyword
'let' is block-scoped, 'const' is function-scoped, and 'var' is globally scoped
'let' is for integers, 'const' is for constants, and 'var' is for variables
JavaScript.answer: 'let' is block-scoped, 'const' is function-scoped, and 'var' is globally scoped

JavaScript.question: What is the purpose of the 'addEventListener()' method in JavaScript?
options: Attaches an event handler to an element
Removes an element from the DOM
JavaScript.answer: Attaches an event handler to an element

JavaScript.question: Explain the concept of the 'this' keyword in JavaScript.
options: The 'this' keyword is used for creating loops
The 'this' keyword refers to the current instance of the function or object
The 'this' keyword is only used in arrow functions
The 'this' keyword is a reserved keyword that cannot be used in JavaScript
JavaScript.answer: The 'this' keyword refers to the current instance of the function or object

JavaScript.question: Which built-in function is used for parsing a string to an integer in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'setTimeout()' function in JavaScript?
options: Delays the execution of a function
Sets the interval between function calls
Returns the current date and time
JavaScript.answer: Delays the execution of a function

JavaScript.question: What is the purpose of the 'console.log()' function in JavaScript?
What is a closure in JavaScript, and how does it work?
options: A closure is a type of loop in JavaScript
A closure is a way to execute code asynchronously
A closure is a function that retains access to variables from its lexical scope even after the scope has finished executing
A closure is a built-in JavaScript data type
JavaScript.answer: A closure is a function that retains access to variables from its lexical scope even after the scope has finished executing

JavaScript.question: Explain the concept of prototypal inheritance in JavaScript.
options: Prototypal inheritance is not a feature of JavaScript
Prototypal inheritance is a way to create static classes in JavaScript
Prototypal inheritance is a mechanism by which objects inherit features from one another
Prototypal inheritance is limited to predefined JavaScript objects
JavaScript.answer: Prototypal inheritance is a mechanism by which objects inherit features from one another

JavaScript.question: What are Promises in JavaScript, and how do they work?
options: Promises are used for styling in JavaScript
Promises are a way to handle asynchronous operations and represent a value that might be available now, or in the future
Promises are only used for error handling
Promises are a feature exclusive to server-side JavaScript
JavaScript.answer: Promises are a way to handle asynchronous operations and represent a value that might be available now, or in the future

JavaScript.question: Which operator is used for strict equality in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'async/await' syntax in JavaScript?
options: It is used for defining functions asynchronously
It is a shorthand for writing 'if' statements in JavaScript
It is used for handling asynchronous operations in a more readable and synchronous-like manner
It is an alternative syntax for arrow functions
JavaScript.answer: It is used for handling asynchronous operations in a more readable and synchronous-like manner

JavaScript.question: Explain the concept of the Event Loop in JavaScript.
options: The Event Loop is used for styling web pages
The Event Loop is a mechanism for handling asynchronous operations by continuously checking the call stack and message queue
The Event Loop is a tool for creating animations in JavaScript
The Event Loop is an outdated feature of JavaScript
JavaScript.answer: The Event Loop is a mechanism for handling asynchronous operations by continuously checking the call stack and message queue

JavaScript.question: What is the purpose of the 'Map' and 'Set' objects in JavaScript?
options: Map and Set objects are not part of JavaScript
Map is used for mapping values to keys, and Set is used for creating sets of unique values
Map is used for creating sets of unique values, and Set is used for mapping values to keys
Map and Set objects are used for defining variables
JavaScript.answer: Map is used for mapping values to keys, and Set is used for creating sets of unique values

JavaScript.question: In JavaScript, what does the 'typeof' operator do?
options: Returns the type of a variable or expression
Converts a string to a number
Checks if a variable is defined
JavaScript.answer: Returns the type of a variable or expression

JavaScript.question: What is the purpose of the 'localStorage' and 'sessionStorage' objects in JavaScript?
options: They are used for styling web pages
localStorage is used for storing data with no expiration time, and sessionStorage is used for storing data for the duration of the page session
localStorage is used for storing data for the duration of the page session, and sessionStorage is used for storing data with no expiration time
localStorage and sessionStorage are used for creating animations in JavaScript
JavaScript.answer: localStorage is used for storing data with no expiration time, and sessionStorage is used for storing data for the duration of the page session
